fields.summary: VB: do not assume that VM has a non-empty annotation

comments.body:
Hi [~dmitrii],

We are seeing this in 3.3.0 as well with ESXi 5.0 update 2 and vCenter server 5.1 , do you know how to resolve the error or if it happens only occasionally ?

The euca-configure-vmware command successfully discovered both ESXi hosts via vCenter but no resources are being reported, below is the error snippet from cloud log, which is exactly the same as the one in this ticket.

{code}

Hi [~dshekhawat]! I haven't tried reproducing this, so let me see if my guess is correct in your case. I am guessing that at least one of the ESXi hosts that you are adding has at least one VM on it, running or not. If that's true and the VM is named 'i-XXXX' or 'emi-XXXX-YYYY' and it has an empty annotation field, then I can see how this problem occurs. The solution is to delete the VMs. If the problem returns then we'll have to figure out how these invalid VMs are created. If there is no VM or if it does not look like a Eucalyptus VM, then we'll have to dig in deeper, too.

Thanks [~dmitrii] for your response back. So far from what I know we have seen this error coming on a new setup where we were building a AZ with VMWare ESXi hosts.

I will try to gather more information and get back to you. Also I would open a SUP escalation as this has come from a Customer.

Thanks again.
Upcoming 3.4 adds greater reliance on VM's annotation. The fact that it can't process VM without annotation is a bug that should be fixed.

[~vasya], there seem to be 2 steps to resolve this (unless I'm missing something, very possible)
  1. Have the VMWare Broker ignore those unannotated VM's, but account for the resource
  2. Have the VMWare Broker determine how to add annotation to those VM's/resources

I think #1 would be a sufficient step, but that might be the bulk of the work.

After some tests I can say that Broker does not touch VMs with an annotation it can not recognize. It just does not work if VM does not have annotation. This can be easily fixed. Resource allocation is still invalid and that would require bigger changes.

[~vasya], i think this would be a reasonable first step in this bug fix.  We can document the issue with resource allocation in the event that there are rogue instances running unmanaged by Eucalyptus
[~tjcramer] Could you add target release for the bug?

Notes for QA: Created few empty VMs via vCenter on the same ESXi host. I'd test few scenarios: empty annotation, none Eucalyptus annotation and Eucalyptus style annotation with different cloud ID. In all cased it is nice to test Broker restart as well as regular run as well as vCenter 5.0/5.1.
New warnings with INFO level about none Eucalyptus/different could VMs should be outputted into cloud-output.log.

To be clear, VMs with invalid annotations (empty, not Euca, Euca but wrong cloud ID) should be ignored by the Broker. They should not be deleted and should not cause malfunction of the Broker. Resource accounting may be off, however.
Verified Eucalyptus handled co-existing VMs on an esxi-5.0 host with no annotation and annotations using a different cloud id. Marking as fixed.
